Hierarchy of the Selberg zeta functions
Yasufumi Hashimoto and Masato Wakayama
Abstract
We introduce a Selberg type zeta function of two variables which interpolates several higher Selberg zeta functions. The analytic continuation, the
functional equation and the determinant expression of this function via the
Laplacian on a Riemann surface are obtained.

In [KW3] (see also [Wi]), an analogue of the Casimir effect for a Riemann surface
Γ\H was studied. Actually, the Casimir energy is explicitly evaluated by a definite
integral of the logarithm of the Selberg zeta function ZΓ (s) with respect to s (see

a variation relative to Γ\H in the Teihmüller space (the negative derivative of the
energy gives the force!) In [G1], Gon shows that the first variation of the Selberg
zeta functions is explicitly described by the (local) higher Selberg zeta function and
a period of automorphic forms.

The main aim of this paper is to establish the analytic continuation, functional
equation for t = n ∈ Z and the determinant expressions of ZΓ (s, t) as a function of s
similar to (1.2) which allows to unify the works in, e.g. [D'HP], [Sa] and [KW1]. To
describe the determinant expression, we introduce a two variable gamma function
Γ(s, t) via the zeta regularization which is a generalization of the multiple gamma
function due to [Ba] when t ∈ Z. From the multiple gamma functions, we can define
multiple sine functions (see, e.g. [KK]) which are important in mathematical physics;
for instance, it has been used for expressing the solutions of the quantum KnizhnikZamolodchikov equation [JM]. Using these multiple sine functions together with
a "spectral determinant of sine function for ∆" which we define again by the zeta
regularized product, we obtain a complete higher Selberg zeta function Ẑ(s, n), that

weight 4k holomorphic cusp form and the present higher Selberg zeta functions of
several rank. For the Riemann zeta function case, the analysis can be done in the
same way. See [KMW] for the higher Riemann zeta function of rank 1.
